## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

-----

-----

-----

##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite‚Äôs Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite‚Äôs Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying ‚Äúhello‚Äù and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We‚Äôve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you‚Äôd like.
Here‚Äôs a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html
@pachara-studio thank you :)
Hello @Phonbopit I'm big fan of your blog. Nice to see you in here!
Hi @sroehrick I live in Bangkok and try to work through the course too.
@Phonbopit that's great! We should meet up for a beer sometime. I'm Scott btw

HI!  Nice to meet you all.. I actually just started the Free Code Camp. . so looking forward to meeting you all :)

@theonlyski hi, welcome to Free Code Camp Bangkok, this is a good place to chat and get help, we also have a Facebook group page - https://www.facebook.com/groups/free.code.camp.bangkok where we will organise things like Meetups, Workshops and generally build our community, nice to meet you
totally new here
Hi all

I'm looking forward to it! In the meantime, I'll be connected to this channel to see what's happening in your part of the world. Cheers!
